 For the record, most of what's up, I have not seen. How I vote is based upon what I've heard and what few I have seen.
 Best Actor:Joaquin Phoenix
 Supporting ActorJake Gyllenhaal (Though, I think his best work, while never seing Brokeback Mountain, was actually October Sky or maybe Day After Tomorrow
 ActressReese Witherspoon
 Supporting ActressRachael Weisz
 Anamated FeatureWallace & Gromit In The Curse Of The Were-Rabbit
 Art Direction (Direction for art?)King Kong
 CinematographyThe New World (Okay, to be honest, Batman was the only one in that list that I saw and it was the Cinematography of it that I did't like.
 Costume DesignCharile And The Chocolate Factory
 DirectingMunich (Honestly, don't know much about it but it sounds artsy.
 DocumentaryMarch Of The Penguins
 Documentary ShortGod Sleeps In Rwanda
 Film EditingWalk The Line
 Foreign Language FilmJoyeux Noël (Seemed to be the one hardest to pernounce
 Makeup (Finally, I've seen 2 in this catagory)Star Wars Episode III Revenge Of The Sith (Though I hate that a movie like that gets limited to "Makeup"
 ScoreOne of the John Willims ones, I don't care. Or maybe Brokeback Mountain. I didn't see any of these so it doesn't reall matter beyond what I said in my first post.
 SongDolly Parton "Travelin' Thru" from Transamerica. She's been herd of before and I don't know how comfortable ABC will be using the word PIMP.
 PictureBrokeback Mountain (simply because it won all those awards awile back.
 Short Film (Animated)One Man Band
 Short (Live Action) FilmThe Last Farm
 Sound EditingWar Of The Worlds (Hello, alien tripods)
 Sound MixingThe Chronicles Of Narnia: The Lion, The Witch And The Wardrobe
 Visual EffectsKing Kong
 Writing (Adapted Screenplay)A History Of Violence (Not really, but I didn't see any of them anyway.
 Writing (original Screenplay)Match Point
 Okay, well that's my list. But of the movies up for awards, I only saw Cronicles, Star Wars, War Of The Worlds, Batman & Wallace And Gromit.
